project.title: Esplorando il Corpo Umano
project.description: A transformative 7-day Youth Exchange using the human body as a metaphor to address mental health, misinformation, mobility, and sustainability through non-formal education.
project.genesis: Born from the Youth Exchange 'Green, Sustainable and Healthy Living' in Denmark (December 2024), ECU emerged from the shared vision of creating a holistic approach to youth empowerment through the body metaphor.
project.body_metaphor_rationale: The human body serves as a universal, accessible metaphor that connects abstract societal challenges to concrete personal experience. Each body part represents both a physiological function and a societal dimension, making complex topics tangible and relatable.

days.metaphor_explanation: The skin is the boundary between 'Me' and 'You', between inner self and external world. It's the first point of contact, where identity meets diversity, where stereotypes are formed and can be deconstructed.
key_objectives: Develop intercultural awareness in 80% of participants
Deconstruct at least one specific stereotype per person
Create a safe and inclusive group space
Establish community guidelines through participatory process

eu_youth_goal.title: Inclusive Societies
eu_youth_goal.connection: Addressing diversity, deconstructing stereotypes, and creating inclusive spaces

sessions.title: Opening Ceremony
sessions.description: The opening ceremony officially introduces the ECU youth exchange and the human body metaphor that will guide the entire educational journey. The session takes place in plenary in a circle to foster equality, visibility, and active participation. Through a shared symbolic ritual, participants immediately build a sense of belonging to the European group and an emotional connection with the project.

sessions.title: Ice-Breaking: Names & Stories
sessions.description: This session uses cooperative games, movement activities and personal storytelling to facilitate mutual acquaintance and break down initial barriers. Through physical energizers, name games and the creation of a human map of Europe, participants learn through direct experience, the body and storytelling.

sessions.title: Workshop: La Pelle come Confine e Contatto
sessions.description: This session uses the metaphor of skin as a boundary and contact point to guide the group in building the Youth Exchange coexistence agreement. Through individual reflection and work in mixed small groups, participants explore their personal boundaries, fears, and expectations related to the intercultural context.

sessions.title: Body Mapping Individuale
sessions.description: Through an art-based learning methodology, participants create a personal body map to explore identity, emotions, competences, roots, and aspirations. The body silhouette becomes a visual and symbolic tool to reflect on oneself, going beyond verbal language.

sessions.title: Reflection Families Formation
sessions.description: The structure of Reflection Families is introduced - small stable groups that will accompany participants throughout the week. Through dialogic explanation and participatory group formation, participants understand the value of daily reflection as an integral part of the learning process.

sessions.title: Intercultural Evening
sessions.description: The intercultural evening represents a key moment of informal learning. Through food, music, dance, games, and storytelling, participants share elements of their cultures in a spontaneous and participatory way.

days.metaphor_explanation: Feet carry us forward, connecting us to our roots while enabling movement. They symbolize migration, mobility as a European value, and the paths that shape our identities.
key_objectives: Understand mobility as both a right and an educational tool
Map personal and family migration stories
75% of participants feel 'more European' after activities

eu_youth_goal.title: Moving Rural Youth Forward
eu_youth_goal.connection: Addressing geographical barriers through mobility experiences

sessions.title: Energizer: Moving Bodies
sessions.description: The day opens with a physical energizer based on movement. Through games like The Wind Blows and Cross the Line, participants move, change positions, and visually observe who shares similar experiences.

sessions.title: Workshop: Da dove veniamo, dove andiamo
sessions.description: The workshop uses visual mapping, storytelling, and learning by doing to explore personal and family mobility stories. Participants collectively build a large map of Europe on the ground, tracing with colored threads the paths of grandparents, parents, themselves, and future desires for movement.

sessions.title: Simulation Game: European Paths
sessions.description: This session uses simulation-based learning and role play to let participants experience mobility and migration in Europe. Through fictitious characters and thematic stations (border, work, home, bureaucracy, community), participants make decisions, face obstacles and experience privileges or discrimination.

sessions.title: Visita Outdoor: Messina Crocevia del Mediterraneo
sessions.description: The activity uses place-based learning and outdoor learning to connect the theme of mobility to history and the host territory. Through a narrative urban trek, participants explore symbolic places in Messina linked to journeys, cultural encounters, and historical migrations.

sessions.title: Reflection Families
sessions.description: In the small stable reflection groups (Reflection Families), participants process the intense experiences of the day, particularly the simulation and the outdoor visit.

sessions.title: Intercultural Evening
sessions.description: The intercultural evening represents a powerful moment of informal learning, where participants discover diverse cultures through music, dance, games, food, and storytelling.

days.metaphor_explanation: The stomach digests what we consume, transforming it into energy. It represents our relationship with food, resources, and the environment - what we take in and how we process it.
key_objectives: 70% commit to changing at least one food-related behavior
Calculate carbon footprint of food choices

eu_youth_goal.title: Sustainable Green Europe
eu_youth_goal.connection: Promoting environmental sustainability through food and consumption awareness

sessions.title: Energizer: Food Chain Game
sessions.description: The day opens with a thematic energizer using movement, games, and visualization to introduce the topic of sustainable food. Through creating a physical food chain network, participants experience the interdependence between natural resources, production, consumption, and waste in a playful and embodied way.

sessions.title: Workshop: Carbon Footprint del Cibo
sessions.description: The workshop uses problem-based learning, simplified data analysis, and learning by doing to make the environmental impact of daily food choices understandable. Participants work in national groups analyzing a typical shopping cart, calculating its CO2 footprint, and identifying high and low impact foods.

sessions.title: World Café: Cibo e Cultura
sessions.description: Through the World Café methodology, participants explore food as an element of identity, culture, and society. Thematic tables allow for structured reflection on memory, tradition, sustainability, and the future of food.

sessions.title: Visita Mercato Locale + Cooking Workshop Km0
sessions.description: This session uses learning by doing, outdoor learning and cooperative learning to connect theory and practice. Participants visit a local market and a supermarket in Furnari guided by a chef, interacting directly with producers to understand seasonality, short supply chain and Km0 value. Subsequently they work in mixed teams to prepare traditional dishes using local ingredients.

sessions.title: Cena Collettiva KM0 + Green Commitment Ceremony
sessions.description: The collective KM0 dinner represents a powerful moment of informal learning and storytelling. Participants present the dishes prepared, describing ingredients, origins, and processes. This is followed by the Green Commitment ceremony where each participant formulates a personal pledge related to sustainable food or environmental choices.

days.metaphor_explanation: The heart is the emotional center, pumping life force through the body. It represents vulnerability, empathy, emotional intelligence, and the courage to address mental health openly.
key_objectives: Create safe spaces for emotional expression

eu_youth_goal.title: Mental Health and Wellbeing
eu_youth_goal.connection: Providing tools for emotional regulation and mental health awareness

sessions.title: Check-in Emotivo: Meteo Interiore
sessions.description: The day opens with a structured emotional check-in using body awareness practices and symbolic sharing to create an atmosphere of safety and trust. Through a brief guided body scan and the use of weather metaphors to describe their emotional state, participants learn to recognize and name emotions without judgment.

sessions.title: Workshop: Emotional Mapping
sessions.description: The workshop uses experiential learning, visual learning, and self-reflection to explore the relationship between emotions and the body. Through the use of the Emotion Wheel and graphic mapping of bodily sensations, participants develop emotional awareness and expand their emotional vocabulary.

sessions.title: Theatre of the Oppressed
sessions.description: This session uses the Theatre of the Oppressed method as a tool for non-formal education and social transformation. Through Forum Theatre, participants explore real situations of exclusion, discrimination and conflict. Learning is highly experiential and based on role play.

sessions.title: Mid-Term Evaluation: Pizza Evaluation
sessions.description: The mid-term evaluation uses a participatory and visual methodology to collect qualitative and quantitative feedback. Through the pizza metaphor, participants reflect on the program, group dynamics, personal well-being, and learning.

sessions.title: Safe Space Circle
sessions.description: The Safe Space Circle is a protected space for emotional sharing that uses circle work practices, active listening, and voluntariness. Participants can share personal experiences, emotions, or deep reflections, without pressure to intervene.

sessions.title: Reflection Families
sessions.description: In the stable Reflection Families groups, participants deeply process the day's emotionally intense experiences. Through guided questions, sharing, and peer support, they develop self-reflection and emotional regulation skills.

sessions.title: Mindfulness: Chiaro di Luna
sessions.description: The day concludes with an outdoor mindfulness session using body-based learning, outdoor education, and contemplative practices. Through guided breathing, body scan, and meditation, participants experience concrete self-regulation and relaxation techniques by moonlight.

days.metaphor_explanation: The head processes information, distinguishes truth from noise, and makes sense of the world. It represents critical thinking, media literacy, and the ability to navigate the digital information landscape.
key_objectives: Understand algorithmic bias and filter bubbles

eu_youth_goal.title: Information and Constructive Dialogue
eu_youth_goal.connection: Promoting media literacy and critical thinking in the digital age

sessions.title: Energizer: True or False?
sessions.description: The day opens with an interactive energizer based on movement in space and a participatory quiz. Participants are invited to physically take a position regarding true or false statements related to fake news, cognitive biases, and online information.

sessions.title: Workshop: Fact-Checking Lab
sessions.description: This practical lab uses inquiry-based learning, problem solving, and learning by doing to develop concrete information verification skills. Participants learn red flags of fake news and experiment with real fact-checking tools by applying them to authentic cases.

sessions.title: Simulation Game: News Factory
sessions.description: Through a competitive role-playing game, participants experience the process of creating fake news to understand its internal mechanisms. Using simulation-based learning and role play, groups create manipulated news and subsequently try to unmask those of others.

sessions.title: Workshop: Algoritmi e Bolle
sessions.description: The workshop uses learning by discovery and experiential learning to make visible the functioning of social media algorithms and the concept of echo chambers. Participants analyze their digital feeds, compare results, and reflect on the consequences of content personalization.

sessions.title: Digital Cleanup Session
sessions.description: This practical session uses learning by doing and gamification to promote sustainable digital habits. Participants concretely clean up their devices (email, cloud, apps, notifications), connecting digital wellbeing to the environmental impact of digital technology.

sessions.title: Reflection Families
sessions.description: In the stable Reflection Families groups, participants deeply reflect on themes of critical thinking, information, and digital citizenship. Through guided questions and peer learning, they connect the day's activities to Youthpass competences.

sessions.title: Digital Detox & Analog Board Games Night
sessions.description: The tech-free evening represents an experience of informal learning and well-being. Through analog games, music, storytelling, and direct interaction, participants experience modes of relationship not mediated by screens.

days.metaphor_explanation: Hands are tools of creation and transformation. They represent agency, doing, making, and shaping reality through civic action and creative expression.

eu_youth_goal.title: Space and Participation for All
eu_youth_goal.connection: Empowering youth for active citizenship and democratic participation

sessions.title: Energizer: Human Machine
sessions.description: The day starts with a creative and bodily energizer. Participants, divided into groups, build a 'human machine' made of movements, sounds, and interactions, connected to the themes addressed in previous days.

sessions.title: Workshop: From Global to Local
sessions.description: This workshop uses project-based learning and problem analysis to help participants connect European priorities and global project themes with their local realities. Through visual tools like Problem Tree and Solution Tree, groups analyze causes and consequences of local issues.

sessions.title: National Action Planning
sessions.description: Participants work in national groups to transform ideas into concrete action plans to implement after the exchange. Using project-based learning, each group defines SMART objectives, target groups, activities, resources, and responsibilities.

sessions.title: Maker Lab
sessions.description: The Maker Lab is a practical space for learning by doing and creative learning where participants produce concrete outputs for project dissemination and follow-up. Through thematic stations (video, graphic design, writing, photography), they experiment with digital and analog tools.

sessions.title: Hands Together: Community Action
sessions.description: This service learning activity allows participants to experience active citizenship through concrete action for the benefit of the local community. Working together, they apply values of solidarity, civic responsibility, and cooperation.

sessions.title: Presentation of Action Plans
sessions.description: In plenary, national groups present their Action Plans, making their commitment public. Using public commitment and peer learning, participants reinforce their motivation for future implementation.

sessions.title: Reflection Families + Green Challenge Finale
sessions.description: The day closes with a reflection allowing processing of the action experience and connecting it to sustainability values. Through reflective learning and celebration, participants evaluate their contribution and confirm their commitments.

days.metaphor_explanation: The whole body represents the integration of all parts - mind, heart, hands, and soul working together. It's about holistic wellbeing, balance, and recognizing the complete journey.
key_objectives: Reflect on the full learning journey
Close the experience with recognition and emotional closure

eu_youth_goal.title: Comprehensive Learning Recognition
eu_youth_goal.connection: Integrating all EU Youth Goals addressed throughout the week

sessions.title: Good Morning Body: Risveglio Olistico
sessions.description: The final day begins with an activity guiding participants to reconnect with their whole body. Through gentle movements, conscious breathing, and micro-exercises linked to previous days' themes (feet, stomach, heart, head, hands), participants integrate body, mind, and emotions.

sessions.title: Youthpass Workshop
sessions.description: Structured session dedicated to final reflection on learnings and recognition of competences developed. Through guided self-assessment, participants analyze activities performed and link them to the 8 key European competences.

sessions.title: Body Maps Gallery
sessions.description: The space is transformed into an exhibition gallery gathering all materials produced during the week. Using visual learning and reflective learning, participants explore the collective journey through Body Maps, posters, action plans, and creative content.

sessions.title: Final Evaluation: River of Learning
sessions.description: The final evaluation uses the river metaphor to represent experience as a learning journey. Through participatory evaluation and narrative reflection, participants build a large collective 'river', identifying moments of challenge, discovery, and growth.

sessions.title: Echo Circle: Cerchio di Chiusura
sessions.description: Final emotional closing circle. Each participant is invited, voluntarily, to share a word, a thank you, and a commitment for the future.

sessions.title: Reflection Families Finale
sessions.description: Last meeting of Reflection Families, dedicated to closing the small groups. Participants reflect on what they take home from the experience, personal learnings, and bonds built.

sessions.title: Closing Ceremony
sessions.description: Official project closing ceremony. Through symbolic moments, video recaps, thank yous, and certificate distribution, participants see their learning path recognized.

sessions.title: Farewell Party
sessions.description: Final farewell party dedicated to celebrating the relationships built. Through music, dance, conversations, and spontaneous rituals, participants consolidate intercultural bonds.
